meanings.definition: To gather or collect (something) by sweeping or raking.
meanings.sent1: I raiks the fallen leaves into a pile.
meanings.sent2: She always raiks the toys into the toy chest after playing.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to raiks all the nuts in one go, but they kept rolling away.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter raiks happiness in the hearts of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The farmer raiks the ripe apples from the tree with care.

meanings.definition: A long-handled tool with a row of projecting teeth at its head, used especially for gathering leaves or cut grass.
meanings.sent1: Dad uses the raiks to clean up the yard every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The gardener left the raiks leaning against the shed after finishing the job.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy ran off with the raiks, thinking it was a new toy.
meanings.sent4: The raiks stood tall in the corner of the garage, waiting for the next gardening season.
meanings.sent5: The old raiks had seen many seasons of hard work and still stood strong.
